channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2024021053
item.description:
Report X-2024021053

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER. RESPONDER CONSULTED WITH THE DECSION TREE ON HOW TO PROCEED WITH CLEAN UP. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE GUIDLINES IN THE DECSION TREE FOR CLEAN UP. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

RESPONDER CONSULTED THE DECSION TREE ON HOW TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL FOLLOWING DECSION TREE GUIDLINES. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024020966
item.description:
Report X-2024020966

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ONE CAN WAS LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAP AND SOILED THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report E-2024020371
item.description:
Report E-2024020371

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-21
  • City: Centerville
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COFFEYVILLE RESOUCES CRUDE TRANSPORTATION, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Transport was headed West on CR1077, when the vehicle failed to negotiate the curve that curved back South. Driver stated he looked away from the roadway to check on an empty water bottle, when his steer tire went over the shoulder. The driver decided not to correct the transport, striking trees and caution chevrons, overturning the transport and splitting the trailer in half on impact. The trailer released the entire load 154 barrels. Safety was immediately dispatched from Coffeyville Resources to start clean up and remediation. The Kansas Highway Patrol was dispatched at the time of the incident, the road was diverted while the transport and trailer was towed. Clean up began on 01/21 but was delayed due to weather conditions (rain and ice). The soil has been dug up and transported to a landfill. The Coffeyville Resources Pipeline group hauled Vac trucks of the water used to keep the soil from continuing to be contaminated to the Coffeyville Refinery. The clean up was completed on 2/16.
